overview: From 2025-08-22 to 2025-08-23, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Improve UX and testability of CircleCI config
topIssues.author: alfonso-op
topIssues.body:
Dealing with the 2,500+ line monorepo CircleCI config is daunting and introduces developer friction.

One of the key pain points discussed in today’s Protocol retro is that there’s no good way to test changes locally. There is the `circleci` CLI which CircleCI provides that’s intended for this purpose, but engineers have not been able to get it to work when they tried it on their machines.

Some ideas:
* Get the `circleci` tool to work for our dev environment
* Move as much logic as possible out of the config itself and into just or make files. The Rust team has followed this approach (see [here](https://github.com/op-rs/kona/blob/main/.github/workflows/rust_ci.yaml))

topPRs.title: feat(cannon): reduce info logging frequency from %100000 to %1000000
topPRs.author: rickck11
topPRs.body:
Reduce the default progress logging frequency for long-running cannon processes

The current default `--info-at "%100000"` produces excessive logs during long-running fault proof executions:

```
level=INFO msg="processing" step=100000 pc=0x00061a80 insn=0x8c0006a0 ips=4840632.11 pages=101 mem=1512KB name="main.main" time=20.658459ms
level=INFO msg="processing" step=200000 pc=0x000c3500 insn=0x8c000d40 ips=3076743.58 pages=201 mem=2512KB name="main.main" time=65.003792ms
level=INFO msg="processing" step=300000 pc=0x00124f80 insn=0x8c0003e0 ips=2794977.89 pages=301 mem=3512KB name="main.main" time=107.335375ms
```

topContributors.summary: scharissis: Focused on code quality and collaboration, providing 8 review comments across various pull requests.

rickck11: Focused on optimizing logging frequency, merging a PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#17186) that reduced informational logging for the cannon component. This work primarily involved code changes related to other work.
ZakAyesh: Merged a documentation update in ethereum-optimism/community-hub#1177, focusing on other work.
Wazabie: Focused on tests work, modifying 10 files with 3 commits (+69/-13 lines), indicating a primary focus on improving test coverage and reliability. They also provided one approval review.
jvmi7: Focused on foundational planning for optimism.io, evidenced by the creation of issue ethereum-optimism/ecosystem#930 to spike CMS architecture.
alfonso-op: Focused on improving developer experience and testability, evidenced by the creation of an issue to improve the CircleCI configuration (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17184).
